question_text: Solve the inequality -6(x + 3) \(\leq\) 4(x - 2)
subject: mathematics

question_text: Find r, if 6r78 = 5119
subject: mathematics

question_text: A student measures a piece of rope and found that it was 1.26m long. If the actual length of the rope was 1.25m, what was the percentage error in the measurement?
subject: mathematics
explanation: Actual length of rope = 1.25mMeasured length of rope = 1.26merror = (1.26 - 1.25)m - 0.01mPercentage error = \(\frac{error}{\text{actual length}}\) x 100%= \(\frac{0.01}{1.25}\) x 100% = 0.08%

question_text: At what rate will the interest on ₦400 increases to ₦24 in 3 years reckoning in simple interest?
subject: mathematics
explanation: Using simple interest = \(\frac{P \times T \times R}{100}\),  where: P denoted principal = ₦400 T denotes time = 3 years  R denotes interest rate = ? 24 = \(\frac{400 \times 3 \times R}{100}\) 24 x 100 = 400 x 3 x R  R = \(\frac{24 \times 100}{400 \times3}\)  = 2%

question_text: Given that log 2 = 0.3010, log 7 = 0.8451. Evaluate log 112.
subject: mathematics

question_text: If x \(\ast\) y = x + y2, find the value of (2 \(\ast\) 3)\(\ast\)5
subject: mathematics

question_text: The 3rd term of an arithmetic progression is -9 and the 7th term is -29. Find the 10th term of the progression
subject: mathematics

question_text: Find \(\int\)(sin x + 2) dx.
subject: mathematics

question_text: At what value of X does the function y = -3 - 2x + X2 attain a minimum value?
subject: mathematics
explanation: Given that y = -3 - 2x + X2 then, \(\frac{dy}{dx}\) = -2 + 2x At maximum value, \(\frac{dy}{dx}\) = O therefore, -2 + 2x 2x = 2 x = 2/2 = 1

question_text: Find the equation of a line parallel to y = -4x + 2 passing through (2,3)
subject: mathematics
explanation: By comparing y = mx + c with y = -4x + 2, the gradient of y = -4x + 2 is m1 = -4 Let the gradient of the line parallel to the given line be m2, then, m2 = m1 = -4 (condition for parallelism)  Using: y - y1 = m2(x - x1) Hence the equation of the parallel line is  y - 3 = -4(x-2) y - 3 = -4 x + 8 y + 4x = 8 + 3 y + 4x = 11 y + 4x - 11 = 0

question_text: Make Q the subject of formula if p = \(\frac{M}{5}\)(X + Q) + 1
subject: mathematics

question_text: If 9x2 + 6xy + 4y2 is a factor of 27x3 - 8y3, find the other factor.
subject: mathematics
explanation: 27x3 - 8y3 = (3x - 2y)3 But 9x2 + 6xy + 4y2 = (3x +2y)2 So, 27x3 - 8y3 = (3x - 2y)(3x - 2y)2 Hence the other factor is 3x - 2y

question_text: Factorize completely \(\frac{x^3 + 3x^2 - 10x}{2x^2 - 8}\)
subject: mathematics

question_text: Solve for x and y if x - y = 2 and x2 - y2 = 8
subject: mathematics

question_text: If x is inversely proportional to y and x = 2\(\frac{1}{2}\) when y = 2, find x if y = 4
subject: mathematics

question_text: For what range of values of x is \(\frac{1}{2}\)x + \(\frac{1}{4}\) > \(\frac{1}{3}\)x + \(\frac{1}{2}\)?
subject: mathematics

question_text: Solve the inequalities -6 \(\leq\) 4 - 2x < 5 - x.
subject: mathematics
explanation: -6 \(\leq\) 4 - 2x < 5 - x  split inequalities into two and solve each part as follows:  -6 \(\leq\) 4 - 2x = -6 - 4 \(\leq\) -2x -10 \(\leq\) -2x \(\frac{-10}{-2}\) \(\geq\) \(\frac{-2x}{-2}\) giving 5 \(\geq\) x or x \(\leq\) 5 4 - 2x < 5 - x  -2x + x < 5 - 4 -x < 1 \(\frac{-x}{-1}\) > \(\frac{1}{-1}\) giving x > -1 or -1 < x Combining the two results, gives -1 < x \(\leq\) 5

question_text: Find the sum to infinity of the following series. 0.5 + 0.05 + 0.005 + 0.0005 + .....
subject: mathematics

question_text: If \(\begin{vmatrix} x & 3 \\ 2 & 7 \end{vmatrix}\) = 15, find the value of x
subject: mathematics

subject: mathematics

question_text: If P = \(\begin{pmatrix} 2 & -3 \\ 1 & 1 \end{pmatrix}\)
subject: mathematics

question_text: The interior angles of a quadrilateral are (x + 15)o, (2x - 45)o and (x + 10)o. Find the value of the least interior angle.
subject: mathematics
explanation: (x + 15)o + (2x - 45)o + (x + 10)o = (2n - 4)90o when n = 4 x + 15o + 2x - 45o + x - 30o + x + 10o = (2 x 4 - 4) 90o 5x - 50o = (8 - 4)90o 5x - 50o = 4 x 90o = 360o 5x = 360o + 50o 5x = 410o x = \(\frac{410^o}{5}\) = 82o Hence, the value of the least interior angle is (x - 30o) = (82 - 30)o = 52o

question_text: A cylindrical pipe 50cm long with radius 7m has one end open. What is the total surface area of the pipe?
subject: mathematics
explanation: Total surface area of the cylindrical pipe = area of circular base + curved surface area  = \(\pi\)r2 + 2\(\pi\)rh = \(\pi\) x 72 + 2\(\pi\) x 7 x 50 = 49\(\pi\) x 700\(\pi\) = 749\(\pi\)m2

question_text: Find the distance between the points (\(\frac{1}{2}\), -\(\frac{1}{2}\)).
subject: mathematics

question_text: If cot\(\theta\) = \(\frac{8}{15}\), where \(\theta\) is acute, find sin\(\theta\)
subject: mathematics
explanation: cot\(\theta\) = \(\frac{1}{\cos \theta}\) = \(\frac{8}{15}\)(given) tan\(\theta\) = \(\frac{15}{18}\) By Pythagoras theorem,  x2 = 152 + 82 x2 = 225 + 64 = 289 x = \(\sqrt{289}\)  = 17  Hence sin\(\theta\) = \(\frac{15}{x}\) = \(\frac{15}{17}\)

question_text: If y = (2x + 1)3, find \(\frac{dy}{dx}\)
subject: mathematics
explanation: If y = (2x + 1)3, then  Let u = 2x + 1 so that, y = u3 \(\frac{dy}{du}\) = 3u2 and \(\frac{dy}{dx}\) = 2  Hence by the chain rule,  \(\frac{dy}{dx}\) = \(\frac{dy}{du}\) x \(\frac{du}{dx}\) = 3u2 x 2  = 6u2 = 6(2x + 1)2

question_text: If y = x sinx, find \(\frac{dy}{dx}\)
subject: mathematics
explanation: If y = x sinx, then  Let u = x and v = sinx  \(\frac{du}{dx}\) = 1 and \(\frac{dv}{dx}\) = cosx Hence by the product rule,  \(\frac{dy}{dx}\) = v \(\frac{du}{dx}\) + u\(\frac{dv}{dx}\) = (sin x) x 1 + x cosx = sinx + x cosx

question_text: Evaluate \(\int^{2}_{0}(x^3 + x^2)\)dx.
subject: mathematics

question_text: \(\begin{array}{c|c} \text{Marks} & 2 & 3 & 4 & 5 & 6 & 7 & 8 \\ \hline \text{No. of students} & 3 & 1 & 5 & 2 & 4 & 2 & 3\end{array}\)From the table above, if the pass mark is 5, how many students failed the test?
subject: mathematics
explanation: From the table, the number of students who failed the test is given as: 3 + 1 + 5 = 9

question_text: \(\begin{array}{c|c} \text{Marks} & 1 & 2 & 3 & 4 & 5\\ \hline \text{Frequency} & 2 & 2 & 8 & 4 & 4\end{array}\)The table above shows the marks obtained in a given test. How many students took the test?
subject: mathematics
explanation: from the table, the number of students who took the test is 2 + 2 + 8 + 4 + 4 = 20

question_text: \(\begin{array}{c|c} \text{Marks} & 1 & 2 & 3 & 4 & 5\\ \hline \text{Frequency} & 2 & 2 & 8 & 4 & 4\end{array}\)The table above shows the marks obtained in a given test. Find the mean mark.
subject: mathematics

question_text: In how many ways can a committee of 2 women and 3 men be chosen from 6 men and 5 women?
subject: mathematics
explanation: A committee of 2 women and 3 men can be chosen from 6 men and 5 women, in \(^{5}C_{2}\) x \(^{6}C_{3}\) ways  = \(\frac{5!}{(5 - 2)!2!} \times {\frac{6!}{(6 - 3)!3!}}\) = \(\frac{5!}{3!2!} \times {\frac{6!}{3 \times 3!}}\) = \(\frac{5 \times 4 \times 3!}{3! \times 2!} \times {\frac{6 \times 5 \times 4 \times 3!}{3! \times 3!}}\) = \(\frac{5 \times 4}{1 \times 2} \times {\frac{6 \times 5 \times 4}{1 \times 2 \times 3}}\) = 10 x \(\frac{6 \times 20}{6}\) = 200

question_text: If three unbiased coins are tossed, find the probability that they are all heads
subject: mathematics
explanation: P(H) = \(\frac{1}{2}\) and P(T) = \(\frac{1}{2}\) Using the binomial prob. distribution,  (H + T)3 = H3 + 3H2T1 + 3HT2 + T3 Hence the probability that three heads show in a toss of the three coins is H3 = (\(\frac{1}{2}\))3 = \(\frac{1}{8}\)

question_text: If the area of \(\bigtriangleup\)PQR above is 12\(\sqrt{3}\)cm2, find the value of q?
subject: mathematics
explanation: Let A denote the area of \(\bigtriangleup\)PQR, then A = \(\frac{1}{2} bh\)Using Sin 60\(^{\circ}\) = \(\frac{h}{q}\)h = q sin 60\(^{\circ}\)So A = \(\frac{1}{2}b(q \sin 60^o)\)12\(\sqrt{3} = \frac{1}{2} \times 8 \times q \times \frac{\sqrt{3}}{3}\)12\(\sqrt{3}\) - 2q\(\sqrt{3}\)q = \(\frac{12}{2} = 6\)cm

question_text: In a survey of 50 newspaper readers, 40 read Champion and 30 read Guardian, how many read both papers?
subject: mathematics
explanation: Let C n G = Xn C only = 40 - xn G only = 30 - x40 - X + 30 - X = 5070 - X = 50X = 70 - 50X = 20

question_text: If p and q are two non zero numbers and 18(p+q) = 918+p)q, which of the following must be true?
subject: mathematics
explanation: Using substitution If 18(p+18) = (18 + p)qlet q = 18imply 18(p+18) = (18+p)18i.e 18p + 18 x 18 = 18 x 18 + 18pSince the left hand side = the right hand sideimply that q = 18

question_text: From the diagram above, find x
subject: mathematics
explanation: ∠RTS = 90\(^{\circ}\) (∠ in semi circle)∠UTS = 25\(^{\circ}\) (∠ in alternate segment)X + 90 + 25 = 180(sum of ∠s on a str line)X + 115 = 180 X = 180 - 115X = 65\(^{\circ}\)

question_text: From the cyclic quadrilateral TUVW above, find the value of x
subject: mathematics
explanation: TUVW is a cyclic quad3χ + 20 + 88 = 180 (opp ∠ s of a cyclic quad are supplementary)3χ + 108 = 1803χ = 180 - 1083χ = 72χ = 72/3χ = 24\(^{\circ}\)

question_text: If two smaller sides of a right angled triangle are 4cm and 5cm, find its area

explanation: Area of a triangle = 1/2 base x height= 1/2 x 4 x 5= 10 cm2

question_text: An arc subtends an angle of 50\(^{\circ}\) at the center of circle of radius 6cm. Calculate the area of the sector formed
subject: mathematics
explanation: Area of a sector = θ x πr2360= 50/360 x 22/7 x 36/1= 110/7

question_text: What is the locus of point that is equidistant from points P(1,3) and Q(3,5)?
subject: mathematics
explanation: Locus of a point equidistant from two fixed points is the perpendicular bisector of the straight line joining the points Gradients of PQ = (5-3 / 3-1) = 2/2 = 1Gradient bisector = -1Equation of perpendicular bisector y - y1 = m(χ - χ1y - 4 = -χ + 2y = -χ + 6

explanation: Area of a triangle = 1/2 ab Sinθ12√3 = 1/2 x 8 x q sin 6012√3 = 4 x q x √3/212√3 = 2q√3q =12√32√3q = 6
